      • extractMnemonic

        public static de.esoco.lib.datatype.Pair<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> extractMnemonic(java.lang.String sText)
        Extracts the first mnemonic character that is identified by an '&' (ampersand) prefix from a text string and returns a pair containing the mnemonic character and the resulting string. All other mnemonic prefixes will be stripped from the string. Ampersand characters at the end of the string or which are followed by a whitespace character will be ignored and not removed. A double ampersand will be replaced by a single one.
        Parameters:
        sText - The string to extract the mnemonic character from
        Returns:
        A pair containing the mnemonic character as the first element (NULL for none) and the resulting string stripped from all mnemonics as the second element

      • formatDuration

        public static java.lang.String formatDuration(long nDuration)
        Formats a duration including milliseconds.
        See Also:
        formatDuration(long, boolean)

      • formatDuration

        public static java.lang.String formatDuration(long nDuration,
                                              boolean bWithMilliseconds)
        Formats a duration in milliseconds into the minimal string necessary in the format [[hh:]mm:]ss.mmm. The leading time fragment will only contain the digits necessary. All subsequent fragments will have leading zeros for their maximum amount of digits.
        Parameters:
        nDuration - The duration in milliseconds
        bWithMilliseconds - TRUE to include fractional milliseconds
        Returns:
        The formatted string

      • formatLongDuration

        public static java.lang.String formatLongDuration(long nDuration,
                                                  boolean bWithMilliseconds)
        Formats a certain milliseconds duration into a string. The string format is [[[_+d ]__h ]__m ]__.000s where elements in brackets are displayed only if the corresponding value is greater than zero. Underscores stand for optional character that are only display for non-zero values while 0 stands for leading zeros.
        Parameters:
        nDuration - The duration in milliseconds
        bWithMilliseconds - TRUE to include fractional milliseconds
        Returns:
        The formatted string

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • nextGroup

        public static int nextGroup(java.util.regex.Matcher rMatcher,
                            int nStart)
        Returns the index of the next valid (non-NULL) group from the argument matcher or -1 if no such group exists. The matcher must have been matched against the input sequence before invoking this method. Attention: remember that group indices start with 1, 0 refers to the complete match expression.
        Parameters:
        rMatcher - The matcher to return the group from
        nStart - The index of the group to start with
        Returns:
        The index of the next valid group or -1 if no more exists

      • parseObject

        public static java.lang.Object parseObject(java.lang.String sValue)
        Parses a Java object from a string. Leading and trailing whitespace will be ignored. The type of the returned object depends on the string's contents - if no parseable data can be found the original string will be returned. The following list shows the datatypes that are currently supported with the corresponding regular expression pattern shown in parentheses:
        • String: the default; quotation marks (' or ") will be stripped from the beginning and the end
        • Integer: values containing only digits with an optional leading minus sign (-?[\d]+)
        • boolean: value contains string 'true' or 'false' (case ignored)
        • null: value contains string 'null'
        Parameters:
        sValue - The string value that the object shall be parsed from
        Returns:
        The parsed object

      • simplePatternToRegEx

        public static java.lang.String simplePatternToRegEx(java.lang.String sPattern)
        Converts a simple search pattern (e.g. Window file name patterns like "* .txt") into their regular expression equivalent (".*\.txt").
        • . into \.
        • * into .*
        • ? into .?
        Parameters:
        sPattern - The original simple pattern to convert
        Returns:
        The converted pattern.

      • toAscii

        public static java.lang.String toAscii(java.lang.String sString)
        Converts a string that may contain non-ASCII characters to the corresponding ASCII representation.
        Parameters:
        sString - The string to convert
        Returns:
        The non-ASCII representation of the input string
